meanings.definition: to change or modify before something else happens
meanings.sent1: She prealters her schedule to avoid conflicts.
meanings.sent2: He always prealters his plans to accommodate unexpected changes.
meanings.sent3: The cat prealters its path to chase the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The early bird prealters its route to catch the worm.
meanings.sent5: The chef prealters the recipe to suit different dietary needs.

meanings.definition: describing something that has been altered beforehand
meanings.sent1: The prealters design of the dress made it unique.
meanings.sent2: The prealters report was ready for review.
meanings.sent3: The prealters painting caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The prealters color of the car stood out in the parking lot.
meanings.sent5: The prealters arrangement of the flowers was stunning.

meanings.definition: a person or thing that alters before something else
meanings.sent1: She is a prealters who always plans ahead.
meanings.sent2: The prealters in the group ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel was a prealters, hiding nuts for winter.
meanings.sent4: The prealters of the team was known for their foresight.
meanings.sent5: The prealters in the story predicted the outcome accurately.
